measure.name: build_residential_hpxml
measure.modeler_description: The measure handles geometry by 1) translating high-level geometry inputs (conditioned floor area, number of stories, etc.) to 3D closed-form geometry in an OpenStudio model and then 2) mapping the OpenStudio surfaces to HPXML surfaces (using surface type, boundary condition, area, orientation, etc.). Like surfaces are collapsed into a single surface with aggregate surface area. Note: OS-HPXML default values can be found in the documentation or can be seen by using the 'apply_defaults' argument.

argument.name: hpxml_path
argument.description: Absolute/relative path of the HPXML file.

argument.name: software_info_program_used
argument.description: The name of the software program used.

argument.name: software_info_program_version
argument.description: The version of the software program used.

argument.name: simulation_control_timestep
argument.description: Value must be a divisor of 60.

argument.name: simulation_control_run_period
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'Mar 1 - May 31'. Defaults to the entire year.

argument.name: location_zip_code
argument.description: Zip code of the home address. Either this or the EnergyPlus Weather (EPW) Filepath input below must be provided.

argument.name: location_epw_filepath
argument.description: Path to the EPW file. Either this or the Zip Code input above must be provided.

argument.name: location_site_type
argument.description: The terrain/shielding of the home, for the infiltration model. Defaults to 'Suburban, Normal' for single-family detached and manufactured home and 'Suburban, Well-Shielded' for single-family attached and apartment units.

argument.name: location_soil_type
argument.description: The soil and moisture type.

argument.name: building_year_built
argument.description: The year the building was built.

argument.name: building_unit_multiplier
argument.description: The number of similar dwelling units. EnergyPlus simulation results will be multiplied this value.

argument.name: geometry_unit_type
argument.description: The type of dwelling unit. Use single-family attached for a dwelling unit with 1 or more stories, attached units to one or both sides, and no units above/below. Use apartment unit for a dwelling unit with 1 story, attached units to one, two, or three sides, and units above and/or below.

argument.name: geometry_attached_walls
argument.description: The location of the attached walls if a dwelling unit of type 'single-family attached' or 'apartment unit'.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_floors_above_grade
argument.display_name: Geometry: Unit Number of Floors Above Grade
argument.description: The number of floors above grade in the unit. Attic type ConditionedAttic is included. Assumed to be 1 for apartment units.

argument.name: geometry_unit_cfa
argument.description: The total floor area of the unit's conditioned space (including any conditioned basement floor area).

argument.name: geometry_unit_aspect_ratio
argument.description: The ratio of front/back wall length to left/right wall length for the unit, excluding any protruding garage wall area.

argument.name: geometry_unit_orientation
argument.description: The unit's orientation is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_bedrooms
argument.description: The number of bedrooms in the unit.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_bathrooms
argument.description: The number of bathrooms in the unit. If not provided, defaults to NumberofBedrooms/2 + 0.5.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_occupants
argument.description: The number of occupants in the unit. If not provided, an *asset* calculation is performed assuming standard occupancy, in which various end use defaults (e.g., plug loads, appliances, and hot water usage) are calculated based on Number of Bedrooms and Conditioned Floor Area per ANSI/RESNET/ICC 301. If provided, an *operational* calculation is instead performed in which the end use defaults to reflect real-world data (where possible).

argument.name: geometry_building_num_units
argument.description: The number of units in the building. Required for single-family attached and apartment units.

argument.name: geometry_average_ceiling_height
argument.description: Average distance from the floor to the ceiling.

argument.name: geometry_garage_type
argument.description: The type of attached garage. Only applies to single-family detached units.

argument.name: geometry_foundation_type
argument.description: The foundation type of the building. Garages are assumed to be over slab-on-grade.

argument.name: enclosure_slab
argument.description: The type and insulation level of the slab. Applies to slab-on-grade as well as basement/crawlspace foundations. Under Slab insulation is placed horizontally from the edge of the slab inward. Perimeter insulation is placed vertically from the top of the slab downward. Whole Slab insulation is placed horizontally below the entire slab area.

argument.name: enclosure_window_area_or_wwr_front
argument.display_name: Enclosure: Window Front Area or WWR
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's front facade. Enter a fraction to specify a Window-to-Wall Ratio instead. If the front wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: enclosure_window_area_or_wwr_back
argument.display_name: Enclosure: Window Back Area or WWR
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's back facade. Enter a fraction to specify a Window-to-Wall Ratio instead. If the back wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: enclosure_window_area_or_wwr_left
argument.display_name: Enclosure: Window Left Area or WWR
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's left facade (when viewed from the front). Enter a fraction to specify a Window-to-Wall Ratio instead. If the left wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: enclosure_window_area_or_wwr_right
argument.display_name: Enclosure: Window Right Area or WWR
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's right facade (when viewed from the front). Enter a fraction to specify a Window-to-Wall Ratio instead. If the right wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: enclosure_window_natural_ventilation
argument.description: The amount of natural ventilation from occupants opening operable windows when outdoor conditions are favorable.

argument.name: enclosure_window_interior_shading
argument.description: The type of window interior shading. If shading coefficients are selected, note they indicate the reduction in solar gain (e.g., 0.7 indicates 30% reduction).

argument.name: enclosure_window_exterior_shading
argument.description: The type of window exterior shading. If shading coefficients are selected, note they indicate the reduction in solar gain (e.g., 0.7 indicates 30% reduction).

argument.name: enclosure_window_insect_screens
argument.description: The type of window insect screens.

argument.name: enclosure_window_storm
argument.description: The type of storm window.

argument.name: enclosure_overhangs
argument.description: The type of window overhangs.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_weekday_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Heating Weekday Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekday heating setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_weekend_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Heating Weekend Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekend heating setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_weekday_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Cooling Weekday Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekday cooling setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_weekend_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Cooling Weekend Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekend cooling setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_season_period
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'Nov 1 - Jun 30'. Defaults to year-round heating availability.

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_season_period
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'Jun 1 - Oct 31'. Defaults to year-round cooling availability.

argument.name: hvac_blower_fan_watts_per_cfm
argument.description: The blower fan efficiency at maximum fan speed. Applies only to split (not packaged) systems (i.e., applies to ducted systems as well as ductless mini-split systems). If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Heating Systems, HPXML Cooling Systems, HPXML Heat Pumps) is used.

argument.name: hvac_installation_defects
argument.description: Specifies whether the HVAC system has airflow and/or refrigerant charge installation defects. Applies to central furnaces and central/mini-split ACs and HPs.

argument.name: hvac_ducts
argument.description: The supply duct leakage to outside, nominal insulation r-value, buried insulation level, surface area, and fraction rectangular.

choice.value: Detailed Example: 4 CFM25 per 100ft2, R-4, Deeply Buried
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: 4 CFM25 per 100ft2, R-4, Deeply Buried

choice.value: Detailed Example: 4 CFM25 per 100ft2, R-4, 100% Round
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: 4 CFM25 per 100ft2, R-4, 100% Round

choice.display_name: Detailed Example: 4 CFM25 per 100ft2, R-4, 100% Rectangular

argument.name: hvac_ducts_supply_location
argument.description: The location of the supply ducts. If not provided, defaults based on the foundation/attic type and presence of garage.

argument.name: hvac_ducts_supply_surface_area_fraction
argument.description: The fraction of supply ducts surface area in the given location. If the fraction is less than 1, the remaining duct area is assumed to be in conditioned space. If not provided, defaults to 0.75 if number of conditioned floors above-grade is greater than 1, otherwise 1.

argument.name: hvac_ducts_supply_leakage_fraction
argument.description: The fraction of duct leakage associated with the supply ducts; the remainder is associated with the return ducts.

argument.name: hvac_ducts_return_location
argument.description: The location of the return ducts. If not provided, defaults based on the foundation/attic type and presence of garage.

argument.name: hvac_ducts_return_surface_area_fraction
argument.description: The fraction of return ducts surface area in the given location. If the fraction is less than 1, the remaining duct area is assumed to be in conditioned space. If not provided, defaults to 0.75 if number of conditioned floors above-grade is greater than 1, otherwise 1.

argument.name: hvac_ducts_number_of_return_registers
argument.display_name: HVAC Ducts: Number of Return Registers
argument.description: The number of return registers of the ducts. Only used to calculate default return duct surface area. If not provided, defaults to one return register per conditioned floor.

argument.description: The type of mechanical ventilation system used for whole building ventilation.

argument.name: ventilation_whole_house_fan

argument.name: dhw_solar_thermal
argument.description: The size and type of solar thermal system for domestic hot water.

argument.name: dhw_solar_thermal_collector_azimuth
argument.description: The azimuth of the solar thermal system collectors. Azimuth is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: dhw_solar_thermal_collector_tilt
argument.description: The tilt of the solar thermal system collectors. Can also enter, e.g., RoofPitch, RoofPitch+20, Latitude, Latitude-15, etc.

argument.name: pv_system
argument.description: The size and type of PV system.

argument.name: pv_system_array_azimuth
argument.description: The azimuth of the PV system array. Azimuth is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: pv_system_array_tilt
argument.description: The tilt of the PV system array. Can also enter, e.g., RoofPitch, RoofPitch+20, Latitude, Latitude-15, etc.

argument.name: pv_system_2
argument.description: The size and type of the second PV system.

argument.name: pv_system_2_array_azimuth
argument.description: The azimuth of the second PV system array. Azimuth is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: pv_system_2_array_tilt
argument.description: The tilt of the second PV system array. Can also enter, e.g., RoofPitch, RoofPitch+20, Latitude, Latitude-15, etc.

argument.name: electric_panel_service_feeders_load_calculation_types
argument.display_name: Electric Panel: Service/Feeders Load Calculation Types
argument.description: Types of electric panel service/feeder load calculations. These calculations are experimental research features. Possible types are: 2023 Existing Dwelling Load-Based, 2023 Existing Dwelling Meter-Based. If multiple types, use a comma-separated list. If not provided, no electric panel loads are calculated.

argument.name: electric_panel_baseline_peak_power
argument.description: Specifies the baseline peak power. Used for 2023 Existing Dwelling Meter-Based. If not provided, assumed to be zero.

argument.name: electric_panel_service_voltage

argument.name: electric_panel_service_max_current_rating

argument.description: The service max current rating of the electric panel. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Electric Panels) is used.

argument.name: electric_panel_breaker_spaces_headroom

argument.name: electric_panel_breaker_spaces_rated_total

argument.name: appliance_dishwasher
argument.description: The type of dishwasher.

argument.name: appliance_dishwasher_location
argument.description: The space type for the dishwasher location. If not provided, defaults to conditioned space.

argument.name: appliance_dishwasher_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the dishwasher energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants.

argument.description: The type of refrigerator.

argument.description: The space type for the refrigerator location. If not provided, defaults to conditioned space.

argument.name: appliance_refrigerator_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the refrigerator energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants.

argument.name: appliance_extra_refrigerator
argument.description: The type of extra refrigerator.

argument.name: appliance_extra_refrigerator_location
argument.description: The space type for the extra refrigerator location. If not provided, defaults based on the foundation type and presence of garage.

argument.name: appliance_extra_refrigerator_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the extra refrigerator energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants.

argument.description: The space type for the freezer location. If not provided, defaults based on the foundation type and presence of garage.

argument.name: appliance_freezer_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the freezer energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants.

argument.name: appliance_cooking_range_oven_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the cooking range/oven energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants.

argument.name: misc_fireplace
argument.description: The amount of fireplace usage, relative to the national average. Fireplaces can also be specified as heating systems that meet a portion of the heating load.

argument.name: schedules_filepaths
argument.description: Absolute/relative paths of csv files containing user-specified detailed schedules. If multiple files, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: schedules_unavailable_period_types
argument.description: Specifies the unavailable period types. Possible types are column names defined in unavailable_periods.csv: Vacancy, Power Outage, No Space Heating, No Space Cooling. If multiple periods, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: schedules_unavailable_period_dates
argument.description: Specifies the unavailable period date ranges. Enter a date range like "Dec 15 - Jan 15". Optionally, can enter hour of the day like "Dec 15 2 - Jan 15 20" (start hour can be 0 through 23 and end hour can be 1 through 24). If multiple periods, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: schedules_unavailable_period_window_natvent_availabilities
argument.display_name: Schedules: Unavailable Period Window Natural Ventilation Availabilities
argument.description: The availability of the natural ventilation schedule during unavailable periods. Valid choices are: regular schedule, always available, always unavailable. If multiple periods, use a comma-separated list. If not provided, defaults to 'regular schedule'.

argument.name: advanced_feature
argument.description: Select an advanced research feature to use in the model, if desired.

argument.name: advanced_feature_2
argument.description: Select a second advanced research feature to use in the model, if desired.

argument.name: emissions_scenario_names
argument.description: Names of emissions scenarios. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. If not provided, no emissions scenarios are calculated.

argument.name: emissions_types
argument.description: Types of emissions (e.g., CO2e, NOx, etc.). If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_units
argument.description: Electricity emissions factors units. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. Only lb/MWh and kg/MWh are allowed.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_values_or_filepaths
argument.display_name: Emissions: Electricity Values or File Paths
argument.description: Electricity emissions factors values, specified as either an annual factor or an absolute/relative path to a file with hourly factors. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_number_of_header_rows
argument.display_name: Emissions: Electricity Files Number of Header Rows
argument.description: The number of header rows in the electricity emissions factor file. Only applies when an electricity filepath is used. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_column_numbers
argument.description: The column number in the electricity emissions factor file. Only applies when an electricity filepath is used. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_fossil_fuel_units
argument.description: Fossil fuel emissions factors units. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. Only lb/MBtu and kg/MBtu are allowed.

argument.name: emissions_natural_gas_values
argument.description: Natural gas emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_propane_values
argument.description: Propane emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_fuel_oil_values
argument.description: Fuel oil emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_coal_values
argument.description: Coal emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_wood_values
argument.description: Wood emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_wood_pellets_values
argument.description: Wood pellets emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: additional_properties
argument.description: Additional properties specified as key-value pairs (i.e., key=value). If multiple additional properties, use a |-separated list. For example, 'LowIncome=false|Remodeled|Description=2-story home in Denver'. These properties will be stored in the HPXML file under /HPXML/SoftwareInfo/extension/AdditionalProperties.

argument.name: whole_sfa_or_mf_building_sim
argument.description: If the HPXML file represents a single family-attached/multifamily building with multiple dwelling units defined, specifies whether to run the HPXML file as a single whole building model.

argument.name: whole_sfa_or_mf_existing_hpxml_path
argument.display_name: Whole SFA/MF Building Simulation: Existing HPXML File Path
argument.description: Absolute/relative path of the existing HPXML file. If not provided, a new HPXML file with one Building element is created. If provided, a new Building element will be appended to this HPXML file (e.g., to create a multifamily HPXML file describing multiple dwelling units).

argument.name: combine_like_surfaces
argument.description: If true, combines like surfaces to simplify the HPXML file generated.

argument.name: apply_defaults
argument.description: If true, applies OS-HPXML default values to the HPXML output file. Setting to true will also force validation of the HPXML output file before applying OS-HPXML default values.

argument.name: apply_validation
argument.description: If true, validates the HPXML output file. Set to false for faster performance. Note that validation is not needed if the HPXML file will be validated downstream (e.g., via the HPXMLtoOpenStudio measure).
